body:
@AlexeySmolenchuk Thanks for posting this issue, I can't reproduce your problem locally. 
Could you please provide the log of your failed build?
For `lcms`, the official clearly states that this is an option and it is dependent on the tool feature.

https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO/blob/67a26e4a383d2125bae437432cdad535d55c751b/share/cmake/modules/FindExtPackages.cmake#L126

https://github.com/AcademySoftwareFoundation/OpenColorIO/blob/67a26e4a383d2125bae437432cdad535d55c751b/docs/quick_start/installation.rst#L207:~:text=OpenImageIO-,lcms2,-pybind11

Hi @FrankXie05 

I've prepared a minimalistic repro here: https://github.com/AlexeySmolenchuk/vcpkg_repro_38153


Clone, checkout **main** branch, configure cmake.
```
git clone git@github.com:AlexeySmolenchuk/vcpkg_repro_38153.git --recursive
cd vcpkg_repro_38153
git checkout main
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
```
After bootstrapping I'm getting this error:
```
[cmake] CMake Error at vcpkg/scripts/buildsystems/vcpkg.cmake:859 (_find_package):
[cmake]   Could not find a package configuration file provided by "lcms2" with any of
[cmake]   the following names:
[cmake] 
[cmake]     lcms2Config.cmake
[cmake]     lcms2-config.cmake
...
-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

Checkout to **workaround** branch, which explicitly set [lcms] as dependency. https://github.com/AlexeySmolenchuk/vcpkg_repro_38153/blob/workaround/vcpkg.json#L3 \
Configure cmake.
```
git checkout workaround
cmake ..
```
Now it's working.

Details:
OS Windows 10\
cmake-3.27

Thanks,
Alexey

This proposal is so wrong. Please investigate the error properly.
@AlexeySmolenchuk Your manifest is okay. If you don't need tools, you don't need to ask for tools.
If [lcms] is optional by design it shouldn't be triggered when I build default [opencolorio] without extensions.

This is an automated message. Per our repo policy, stale issues get closed if there has been no activity in the past 28 days. The issue will be automatically closed in 14 days. If you wish to keep this issue open, please add a new comment.

body:
Just in case.
It still doesn't work as expected.
Yeah. No action taken by vcpkg maintainers.

issue.title: [opencolorio] Fix cmake config

labels.name: category:port-bug
labels.description: The issue is with a library, which is something the port should already support

labels.name: info:needs-maintainer-attention
labels.description: Lets the current 'on rotation' vcpkg maintainer know they need to look at this.

repository.name: vcpkg
repository.description: C++ Library Manager for Windows, Linux, and MacOS

issue.body:
Fixes #38153.

lcms is only used by the `tools` feature. And only for executables, not in exported targets.
